ACT
7 
GENERAL PROVISIONS
Everyone is authorized to appoint an heir in the event of his death, and to limit and encumber the right of his heir, in the manner and within the limits determined by this Law.
In order to protect the legitimate interests of members of the immediate family, this Act determines which rights regarding the estate belong to the members of the immediate family, even against the testator's will, and limits are set to testamentary and other dispositions in the event of death.
